message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM

The paper deals with the task of localizing activities in videos using language queries, which involves processing both textual and visual information. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper proposes an end-to-end system that uses reinforcement learning to efficiently localize relevant activity clips in long videos, which involves modeling and optimizing the system's behavior, indicating that the paper may also belong to the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed method on several video datasets, suggesting that it may also belong to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
